data.title: 2024/25 Pre-Season Summary of All 20 Premier League Teams
data.meta_description: In this 24/25 PL pre-season summary blog, we summarize all the pre-season games of the 20 teams with all the goals & assists from every game.
data.meta_site_name: ALLABOUTFPL: Your one stop place for all FPL tips, FPL captain picks, FPL news, FPL players, previews, reviews,differential picks, analysis and weekly updates.
data.text:
In this 24/25 PL pre-season summary blog, we summarize all the pre-season games of the 20 teams with all the goals & assists from every game.

Link to all our 2024/25 Pre-Season articles including all team pre-season friendly updates, team previews, fixture analysis, position-wise analysis, differentials, players to target, budget enablers and more. Completely free to access as well!

Pre-Season Summary of All 20 Premier League Teams

Arsenal Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played: 5 Won:4 Draw:1 Lost: 1

20 July Arsenal XI 2-0 Leyton Orient (Goals: Gabriel Jesus, Smith Rowe. Assists: Gabriel Jesus, Nketiah)

25 July Arsenal 1-1 AFC Bournemouth (Arsenal win 5-4 on pens) (Goal: Fabio Viera. Assist: Reiss Nelson)

28 July Arsenal 2-1 Man Utd (Goal: Fabio Viera, Martinelli Assist: Ethan Nwaneri, Myles Lewis-Skelly)

There was a pre-planned penalty shootout after the game which Man United won 4-3. Ethan Wheatley missed for Man United whereas Kai Havertz & Kiwor missed it for Arsenal)

1 Aug Liverpool 2-1 Arsenal (Goal: Kai Havertz. Assist: Martin Odegaard)

7 Aug Arsenal 4-1 Bayer Leverkusen(Goals : Zinchenko, Trossard, Jesus, Havertz, (Assists: Havertz(2))

11 Aug Arsenal 2 – 0 Lyon (Goals: Saliba, Gabriel) (Assists: Declan Rice)

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Arsenal pre-season guide

Arsenal Friendlies Summary:

Key Notes from Arsenal Pre-Season:

Kai Havertz played a deeper role in Arsenal’s friendly vs Liverpool but still managed to score

“He looks really good. He looks really sharp. He has changed a lot of things over the summer. He has come in top condition again”. “He needs to be in that condition to get the best out of himself. He has realised that. And I’m really happy with what he’s shown today again.” – Arteta on Gabriel Jesus

In the game vs Bayer Leverkusen, Havertz played the 1st half in midfield & picked up 2 assists. He played up top in the 2nd half & scored!

Jesus – ⚽⚽⚽A

Havertz – ⚽⚽A A

Martinelli – ⚽

Trossard- ⚽

Vieira – ⚽

Saliba – ⚽

Gabriel – ⚽

Rice – AA

Odegaard – A

Nketiah – A

Smith Rowe⚽(When he played for Arsenal)

Zinchenko- ⚽

Nelson – A

Myles Lewis-Skelly – A

Ethan Nwaneri – A

Aston Villa Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played: 7 – Won:3, Lost:4

17 July Walsall 0-3 Aston Villa (Goals: Morgan Rogers(x2), Louie Barry) (Assists: Ross Barkley, Samuel Iling-Junior)

20 July Spartak Trnava 0-3 Aston Villa (Goals: Morgan Rogers, Leon Bailey, Cameron Archer) (Assists: Morgan Rogers, Kadan Young)

28 July Columbus Crew 4-1 Aston Villa (Goal: Cameron Archer) (Assist: Leon Bailey)

1 Aug RB Leipzig 2-0 Aston Villa

3 Aug Aston Villa 0-1 Club America

7 Aug Aston Villa 3-2 Athletic Club(Goals: Ramsey, Philogene, Archer, Assists: Rogers, Tielemans, Buendia)

10 Aug Borussia Dortmund 2 – 0 Aston Villa

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’sdetailed Aston Villa pre-season guide

Aston Villa Pre-Season Keynotes:

Watkins did not feature in the last friendly vs Dortmund- Completely not featuring in the pre-season at all which puts his GW1 starting spot at risk. He has returned to training though(on Tuesday).

Nedeljkovic could be a decent shout as a 4.0m defender, he’s a RB & has consistently featured in pre-season

4 Aug Bournemouth 1 – 0 Rayo Vallecano (Goal – Luis Sinisterra)

10 Aug Bournemouth 3 – 2 Girona (Goals: Kluivert(Penalty), Sinisterra, Jebinson) (Assists: Christie, Dango Ouattara, Faivre) – Kluivert took the penalty with Solanke now moving to Spurs

Brentford Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played: 6, Won: 2, Drawn: 3, Lost: 1

20 July Wimbledon 2-5 Brentford (Goals: Igor Thiago(x2), Wissa(Penalty), Bryan Mbeumo, Kevin Schade). (Assists: Fin Stevens, Yunus Emre Konak, Iwan Morgan)

25 July Benfica 1-1 Brentford (Goal: Bryan Mbeumo)

30 July Estrela da Amadora 3-1 Brentford (Goal: Mathias Jensen) (Assist: Damsgaard)

3 Aug Watford 1-1 Brentford (Goal: Kevin Schade) (Assist: Ryan Trevitt)

9 Aug Brentford 4 – 4 Wolfsburg (Goals: Schade, Mbeumo, Jensen, Wissa) (Assists: Mbeumo, Ajer, Janlet, Daamsgard)

Brentford also played a Wolfsburg 11 on the 10th of August, completely different teams from the 4-4 draw. Ben Mee, and Lewis Potter both featured along with Toney. Lewis Potter & Onyeka were the goal scorers in a 2-1 win (2nd 11 game so not added to the summary below)

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s Brentford Pre-season guide

Brentford Pre-Season Notes:

Thiago suffered a meniscus injury during the Bees’ 5-2 victory over AFC Wimbledon on 20 July, which has been repaired. The striker will now begin a period of recovery and rehabilitation and is expected to return towards the end of the year.

Brentford Friendlies Summary:

Brighton Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played:4, Won:4

24 July Kashima Antlers 1-5 Brighton (Goals: Amario Cozier-Duberry(x2), Yasin Ayari, Yankuba Minteh) (Assists: Facundo Buonanotte, Weir, Milner, Simon Adingra)

28 July Tokyo Verdy 2-4 Brighton (Goals: Minteh, Sarimento, Van Hecke, Adingra) (Assists: Buonanotte(x2), Welbeck, Osman)

3 Aug Queens Park Rangers 0-1 Brighton (Goal: Wlebeck(Penalty)) (Assist: Yankuba Minteh)

10 Aug Brighton 4 – 0 Villarreal (Goals: Joao Pedro, Minteh, Welbeck(2)) (Assists: Mitoma(2), Minteh)

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Brighton Pre-season guide

Brighton Pre-Season Notes:

Barco’s absence was precautionary against QPR in their 3rd friendly. No risks after minor muscle issue in training yesterday.

Joao Pedro made his return to Brighton’s 11, he played 45 mins in the last friendly and picked up a goal.

Welbeck scored two penalties in the last two friendlies but Joao Pedro wasn’t on the pitch both times.

Chelsea Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played: 6, Won: 1, Drawn: 2, Lost: 3

25 July Chelsea 2-2 Wrexham (Goals: Nkunku, Ugochukwu) (Assists: Guiu, Broja)

27 July Chelsea 1-4 Celtic (Goal: Nkunku) (Assist: Sterling)

1 Aug Chelsea 3-0 Club America (Goals: Nkunku, Madueke, Guiu) (Assists: Nkunku, Lavia, Dewsbury Hall)

3 Aug Man City 4-2 Chelsea (Goals: Sterling, Madueke) (Assists: Lavia, Madueke)

7 Aug Chelsea 1 – 2 Real Madrid (Goal: Noni Madueke) (Assist: Enzo)

11 Aug Chelsea 1 – 1 Inter Milan (Goal: Ugochukwu)

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Chelsea Pre-season guide

Chelsea Pre-Season Notes:

Enzo Maresca on Nkunku’s great impact in pre-season: “I knew Nkunku before I joined… I love him!”. “He can play in the pocket, as a nine and winger. He’s a very good fit for this system”.

Christopher Nkunku on his fitness and favourite position. “I am not 100 percent now, but I am working towards it and I hope soon I will be fit. I don’t have a favourite position. We are still in the pre-season. We just want to work and accept the ideas of the coach. He said I can play winger, striker or ten.”

Chelsea Friendlies Summary:

Everton Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played: 6, Won: 3, Drawn: 1, Lost: 2

19 July – Sligo Rovers 3-3 Everton (Goals: Holgate, Chermiti(x2) (Assists: Jack Harrison(x2), Chermiti)

27 July – Salford 2-1 Everton (Goal: James Garner) (Assist: Youssef Chermiti)

30 July – Coventry 3-0 Everton

3 Aug – Preston North End 0-3 Everton (Goals: Lindstrøm, DCL, Jake O’Brien) (Assists: Jack Harrison, Dominic Calvert-Lewin)

06 Aug – Everton 6 – 0 Motherwell (Goals: Beto(x2), Muapay(x2), O’Brien, Armstrong) – Behind closed doors friendly only goal data available. Not added to the summary below

10 Aug – Everton 1 – 0 AS Roma (Goal: DCL) (Assist: McNeil)

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Everton Pre-season guide

Everton Pre-Season Key Notes:

DCL won and scored a penalty in Everton’s 3rd friendly vs Preston North End

“Youssef Chermiti has one which will take a while. We’re a bit disappointed in that. He was going well in pre-season and that’s not going to be a short one, not by the looks of things. Jimmy, less so.” – Sean Dyche on Chermiti & Garner

Everton confirmed Youssef Chermiti had undergone minor surgery on a foot injury. The Blues striker sustained the problem during a training session at Finch Farm.

27 July Fulham 6-1 Watford

Saša Lukić scored the penalty after Rodrigo Muniz had been brought down. (Goals: Lukic, Muniz, Iwobi, Raul Jimenez, Adrion Pajaziti, Jay Stansfield) (Assists: Muniz, Iwobi, Raul(x2), Harry Wilson, Josh king)

2 Aug Benfica 0-1 Fulham (Goal: Iwobi, Assist: Robinson)

5 Aug Fulham 1 – 2 Sevilla (Goal: Smith Rowe, Assist: Robinson – Goal video)

10 Aug Fulham 2 – 0 Hoffenheim (Goal: Smith Rowe, Adama Traore) (Assist: Iwobi(x2))

Note: A Fulham 11 played a 60-minute game vs Hoffenheim 11 consisting of players who did not start the other game(2-0 Fulham win) – Playing 11: Benda; Castagne, Araujo, Cuenca, Sessegnon; Reed, Cairney, King; Wilson, Raúl, Stansfield. Goal: Stansfield(x2), Harry Wilson. Not added to the summary below because no other info was available in the match report.

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Everton Pre-season guide

Fulham’s game vs QPR, Watford did not have any further information and hence not added to the friendlies summaries below.

Liverpool Pre-Season Summary

Results: Played: 5, Won: 4, Lost: 1

19 July Liverpool 0-1 Preston

27 July Liverpool 1-0 Real Betis (Goal: Dominik Szoboszlai) (Assist: Salah)

1 Aug Liverpool 2-1 Arsenal (Goals: Mohamed Salah, Fabio Carvalho) (Assists: Harvey Elliott(x2))

4 Aug Man Utd 0-3 Liverpool (Goals: Carvalho, Tsimikas, Curtis Jones) (Assists: Diogo Jota(x2), Mohamed Salah)

11 Aug Liverpool 4 – 1 Sevilla (Goals: Luis Diaz(x2), Diogo Jota, Nyoni) (Assists: Jota, TAA, Szoboszlai)

11 Aug Liverpool 0 – 0 Las Palmas (Liverpool played a second team consisting of players who did not play the game earlier in the day against Sevilla)

Liverpool team vs Las Palmas: Kelleher, Endo, Konate, Nunez (Blair, 67), Jones, Gakpo (Morton, 67), Elliott, Robertson (Scanlon, 60), Phillips (Nallo, 67), Doak, Bradley.

Unused subs: Davies, Gordon, Van den Berg.

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Liverpool Pre-season guide

Liverpool Pre-Season Key Notes:

Slot on Szoboszlai’s absence in their friendly vs Man United: “I think it’s our 13th day of the tour. Dominik joined every session and every game. I think it’s a bit of fatigue and we don’t want to take any risks because we fly back to Liverpool tonight. On Tuesday all the other players arrive as well, so we want to start off then with all the players available.”

Szoboszlai could play an advanced number 10 role but also be a part of a double pivot(deeper role).

Liverpool Friendlies Summary:

31 July Man City 2-2 Barcelona (Goals: Nico O’Reilly, Grealish) (Assists: Kovacic, Gvardiol)

Barcelona won 4-1 on pens

Phillips and Wright penalties were saved by substitute ‘keeper Ander Astralaga while Barcelona made no mistake with their three kicks to seal the victory.

3 Aug Man City 4-2 Chelsea (Goals: Haaland(x3), Bobb) (Assists: James McAtee(x2))

10 Aug Man City 1 – 1 Man Utd (Goal: B Silva) (Assist: Bobb) -> Goal video

Man City won on penalties with Ederson scoring his spot-kick

For more detailed updates on the lineups, goals + assists and minutes check out @FPL_Romfrosk’s detailed Man City Pre-season guide

The above players are highly likely to be not ready to start in GW1

Guardiola on players returning from international duty [incl. Foden, Walker, Rodri]: “We will be late. Not against United [they won’t feature in the Community Shield]. “Against Chelsea, against Ipswich [they will be reintroduced]…” via @1fplnews

Pep Guardiola: “Ederson is our 𝐁𝐄𝐒𝐓 Penalty taker alongside KDB and Haaland”

Newcastle United Pre-Season Key Notes:

Jacob Murphy looks great in pre-season and is expected to be starting at RW at least until they sign a new player

Isak won a penalty in the friendly vs Girona, he took it and missed it

Gordon made his first appearance in pre-season vs Girona and scored a goal

Hall played at LB in the last friendly vs Girona with Burn playing in CB

Newcastle played their last two friendlies in back-to-back days. Most of the main team played vs Girona on Friday Night & did not feature in the game vs Stade Brestois.
